verses.text: Cry aloud , spare not, lift up thy voice like a trumpet , and shew my people their transgression , and the house of Jacob their sins.\f + \fr 58.1 \ft aloud: Heb. with the throat\f*

Yet they seek me daily , and delight to know my ways , as a nation that did righteousness , and forsook not the ordinance of their God : they ask of me the ordinances of justice ; they take delight in approaching to God. \p

¶ Wherefore have we fasted , \add say they\add*, and thou seest not? \add wherefore\add* have we afflicted our soul , and thou takest no knowledge ? Behold, in the day of your fast ye find pleasure , and exact all your labours.\f + \fr 58.3 \ft labours: or, things wherewith ye grieve others: Heb. griefs\f*

Behold, ye fast for strife and debate , and to smite with the fist of wickedness : ye shall not fast as \add ye do this\add* day , to make your voice to be heard on high.\f + \fr 58.4 \ft ye shall…: or, ye fast not as this day\f*

Is it such a fast that I have chosen ? a day for a man to afflict his soul ? \add is it\add* to bow down his head as a bulrush , and to spread sackcloth and ashes \add under him\add*? wilt thou call this a fast , and an acceptable day to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*?\f + \fr 58.5 \ft a day…: or, to afflict his soul for a day?\f*

\add Is\add* not this the fast that I have chosen ? to loose the bands of wickedness , to undo the heavy burdens , and to let the oppressed go free , and that ye break every yoke ?\f + \fr 58.6 \ft the heavy…: Heb. the bundles of the yoke\f*\f + \fr 58.6 \ft oppressed: Heb. broken\f*

\add Is it\add* not to deal thy bread to the hungry , and that thou bring the poor that are cast out to thy house ? when thou seest the naked , that thou cover him; and that thou hide not thyself from thine own flesh ?\f + \fr 58.7 \ft cast…: or, afflicted\f* \p

¶ Then shall thy light break forth as the morning , and thine health shall spring forth speedily : and thy righteousness shall go before thee; the glory of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall be thy rereward.\f + \fr 58.8 \ft be…: Heb. gather thee up\f*

Then shalt thou call , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall answer ; thou shalt cry , and he shall say , Here I \add am\add*. If thou take away from the midst of thee the yoke , the putting forth of the finger , and speaking vanity ;
And \add if\add* thou draw out thy soul to the hungry , and satisfy the afflicted soul ; then shall thy light rise in obscurity , and thy darkness \add be\add* as the noonday :

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall guide thee continually , and satisfy thy soul in drought , and make fat thy bones : and thou shalt be like a watered garden , and like a spring of water , whose waters fail not.\f + \fr 58.11 \ft drought: Heb. droughts\f*\f + \fr 58.11 \ft fail: Heb. lie, or, deceive\f*

And \add they that shall be\add* of thee shall build the old waste places : thou shalt raise up the foundations of many generations ; and thou shalt be called , The repairer of the breach , The restorer of paths to dwell in. \p

¶ If thou turn away thy foot from the sabbath , \add from\add* doing thy pleasure on my holy day ; and call the sabbath a delight , the holy of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, honourable ; and shalt honour him, not doing thine own ways , nor finding thine own pleasure , nor speaking \add thine own\add* words :

Then shalt thou delight thyself in the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; and I will cause thee to ride upon the high places of the earth , and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father : for the mouth of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath spoken \add it\add*.
